intro: Kengyilia grandiglumis, commonly known as the large glume kengyilia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features robust, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its inflorescence consists of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray flowers. Kengyilia grandiglumis typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions.
